title: Trump suggested 'shooting migrants in legs' and 'filling moats with alligators' on Mexico border
text:
Donald Trump put building a new border wall between the US and Mexico at the centre of his election campaign - AFP

Donald Trump proposed border officials "shoot migrants in the legs" and build a moat filled with alligators to stop migrants crossing the US-Mexico border, according to The New York Times.

The US president also wanted his new border wall, a key 2016 campaign promise, to be electrified "with spikes on top that could pierce human flesh", according to officials present for the discussion in March.

The claims were made in an article by two New York Times reporters adapted from their upcoming book on Mr Trump's attempt to curb migration along America's southern border.

According to the report, Mr Trump became increasingly frustrated with the legal and political hurdles to his hard line approach to reducing the tide of migrants attempting to enter the US.

“The president was frustrated and I think he took that moment to hit the reset button,” Thomas Homan, Mr Trump’s former Immigration and Customs Enforcement chief, said of the meeting. “The president wanted it to be fixed quickly.”

Now the press is trying to sell the fact that I wanted a Moat stuffed with alligators and snakes, with an electrified fence and sharp spikes on top, at our Southern Border. I may be tough on Border Security, but not that tough. The press has gone Crazy. Fake News! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 2, 2019

Mr Trump initially proposed closing the entire 2,000 mile southern border but in a two-hour meeting in the Oval Office proposed far more extreme measures.

Mr Trump had already publicly suggested that US soldiers could open fire on migrants approaching America if they threw rocks. When his staff told him that was illegal, Mr Trump suggested in the March meeting that they could instead shoot migrants in the legs to slow them down.

Although Mr Trump eventually was talked out of his most radical ideas, he also reportedly fired key immigration officials who pushed back against his suggestions.

According to the New York Times, Mr Trump shouted at many of his aides during the meeting, telling them: "You are making me look like an idiot". "I ran on this. It’s my issue,” he stressed.

The president reportedly grew frustrated with his immigration officials Credit: AFP More

Among those who reportedly attempted to dissuade the president was Kirstjen Nielsen, his then homeland security secretary, who told him the measures would not achieve his desired aim.

The paper reported Ms Nielsen also attempted to explain to Mr Trump the need for new powers to take down drones, to which he responded: “Kirstjen, you didn’t hear me the first time, honey... Shoot ’em down. Sweetheart, just shoot ’em out of the sky, OK?”

Ms Nielsen was later ousted from her post in a purge of senior immigration officials including her deputy Claire Grady and the head of US citizenship and immigration services Frank Cissna.

All were replaced with hardliners who have since announced the administration would allow immigrant families to be detained indefinitely and deny green cards for certain immigrants.

Mr Trump has dismissed the claims in the report, tweeting on Wednesday: "Now the press is trying to sell the fact that I wanted a Moat stuffed with alligators and snakes, with an electrified fence and sharp spikes on top, at our Southern Border. I may be tough on Border Security, but not that tough. The press has gone Crazy. Fake News!
description: Donald Trump proposed border officials "shoot migrants in the legs" and build a moat filled with alligators to stop migrants crossing the US-Mexico border, according to The New York Times.
